org.jdesktop.core.animation.i18n

Class I18N

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdesktop.core.animation.i18n.I18N

  • @Utility
public final class I18N
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility that manages a resource bundle of strings based upon the locale for an application.

    Numbered errors are read from the Err file found in this package.

    Author:
    Tim Halloran

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String err(int number)
      Gets the string defined for the given error number from the i18 resource bundle.
      static java.lang.String err(int number, java.lang.Object... args)
      Gets and formats the string defined for the given error number from the i18 resource bundle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • err

        @RegionEffects(value="reads any(java.util.ResourceBundle):Instance")
public static java.lang.String err(int number)
        Gets the string defined for the given error number from the i18 resource bundle. The key for the error message in the Err properties file is error.nnnnn. For example, I18N.err(23) would result in the string "(Timing Framework #23) A singular problem." if the line error.00023=A singular problem.is contained in the Err properties file. If the key is not defined in the Err properties file an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        number - the error message number.
        Returns:
        the error message for the given number.

      • err

        @RegionEffects(value="reads any(java.util.ResourceBundle):Instance, arg1:Instance")
public static java.lang.String err(int number,
                                      java.lang.Object... args)
        Gets and formats the string defined for the given error number from the i18 resource bundle. Calling this method is equivalent to calling String.format(I18N.err(number), args). The key for the error message in the Err properties file is error.nnnnn. For example, I18N.err(24, "bad") would result in the string "(Timing Framework #24) A bad problem." if the line error.00024=A %s problem. is contained in the Err properties file. If the key is not defined in the Err properties file an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        number - the error message number.
        args - the variable arguments to format the resulting error message with.
        Returns:
        the formatted error message for the given number.
        See Also:
        String.format(String, Object...)
